Line a baking sheet with waxed paper and set it aside.
Whisk together 1/2 cup flour, beer, egg, and baking powder in a medium bowl until smooth. Put the coconut and the remaining 1/4 cup flour into two separate bowls.

One at a time, grasp the shrimp by the tail and coat it in flour, shaking off any excess. Dip it in the beer batter and let the excess drip off. Roll it in coconut, then arrange on the lined baking sheet. Chill for 30 minutes.
Working in batches, fry the shrimp in hot oil until golden brown, about 2 to 4 minutes per side. Use a slotted spoon to transfer cooked shrimp to the prepared baking sheet.
Transfer the fried shrimp to a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.
